comment: Sadly, no details here.

All numerals ending with -se-b '1' make distributive forms without =gu, only reduplication: hoc'o-ƛ se-b-se-b 'eleven each'. In compound numerals, only the last element is reduplicated: ɬob-c'ol-lo č'e-č'e=gu '32 each'. There are some exceptions (or I didn't grasp what the pattern is here): лъобцIо-лъобцIолгу '30 each' but бейкь-бейцIолгу '80 each'. Many exceptions appear due to phonetic changes (for example, гьочIоо-чIоцIолгу 'по 90'), they are listed in [suleymanov1957: 311].
Sometimes duplicating roots merge (cardinal гьокьу-гу '7' gives гьокьу-гьокьу-гу => гьокьокьу-гу '7 each').
No info on which dialect is described in this source.
Distributive numerals inflect the way cardinals do.

It is unclear whether =da/=ja can be omitted here. There are two examples with =ja (бō-бойа '2 each', гьацIа-гьацIайа '10 each') and one without (и̃лIи-и̃лIи '6 each'). Either =da/=ja is voluntary here, or it is omitted in some numerals and stays in others, or this is a typo. Distrbutive numerals inflect by case the way adjectives do.

«Distributive numerals are derived by reduplication of the rightmost root morpheme and suffixation according to the rule for cardinal numerals». Distributive numerals can mean 'X units', 'X units each time', or 'in groups of X'. More on quantification on [page 239—240].

-i is added when the reduplicate root ends with a consonant. In some examples -da is attached (for example, ḳejaz-ḳejazda '20 each'). [alekseevetal1998: 253 (in the file)] does not mention any suffixes when talking about this reduplication. Their example is кIе-кIе 'two each'. Is it possible that in some cases -i is omitted due to phonetic reasons?
The «whole form» is reduplicated.

If a root ends with a consonant, -i is attached to the end of the numeral (for example, l‘ab-l‘abi 'three each'). In Tokitin, cardinal and distributive 'two' are the same because the root for 'two' in this subdialect is already reduplicated (k'ek'e). 'One each' is ce-ce, without class marker. [gadzhieva2007: 89] mentions use of an additional word: «Распределительные числительные образуются описательно, посредством глагольной формы бухьагьи „держа“ (бухьагьеду „держать“, ср. собств.-кар. бикке от биккелъа), присоединяемого к числительным с удвоенной основой: це(б)ци бухьагьи „по одному“, кIекIе бухьагьи „по два“».
[alekseyev2016: 3684] mentions that the pattern is either R-R-da or R-da-R-da. He also mentions that 'one each' is ce-ce-CM or ce-CM-ce-CM.

In simple numerals, only the numeral root is reduplicated. In numerals of hundreds the number marker is reduplicated (hab-beši-bešen-da '300 each'), in numerals of tens the root morpheme is reduplicated (habī-hab-ac'a '30 each'). Thousands 2000–9000 can be derived both ways. In complex numerals only the final root is reduplicated. There are some phonetic changes when reduplicating.
Exceptions: 'two each' is č'ē-č'e (no -ra), 'three each' is hab-di-hab-da (-da is reduplicated, too).

«Distributive numerals are formed by adding the plural suffix -t'a to the cardinal stem, and distributive numerals can also be formed by reduplication. The reduplicated distributive numeral can optionally use the suffix -t'a. The meaning of distributive numerals used pronominally refers to a situation in which two or more individuals act on their own, i.e. individually and carry out one or more events with the same results». «In complex numerals, only the last component is reduplicated or receives the distributive suffix -t'a» (for example, oⁿc'on q'ˤʷene-t'a '12') [178]. «When the numeral ends in azar ‘thousand’ or milion ‘million’, the component that precedes this numeral is reduplicated or receives the distributive suffix -t'a. The distributive numerals ‘one thousand’ and ‘one million’ are formed either by attaching the distributive suffix -t'a directly to nouns azar ‘thousand’ and milion ‘million’ when the numeral hos ‘one’ is omitted, the distributive suffix -t'a is added to the numeral hos ‘one’ followed by the numeral ‘thousand’ or ‘million’» [179].

«Distributive numerals are formed by adding the plural suffix -t'a to the cardinal stem, and distributive numerals can also be formed by reduplication. The reduplicated distributive numeral can optionally use the suffix -t'a. The meaning of distributive numerals used pronominally refers to a situation in which two or more individuals act on their own, i.e. individually and carry out one or more events with the same results». «In complex numerals, only the last component is reduplicated or receives the distributive suffix -t'a» (for example, oⁿc'on q'ˤʷene-t'a '12') [178]. «When the numeral ends in azar ‘thousand’ or milion ‘million’, the component that precedes this numeral is reduplicated or receives the distributive suffix -t'a. The distributive numerals ‘one thousand’ and ‘one million’ are formed either by attaching the distributive suffix -t'a directly to nouns azar ‘thousand’ and milion ‘million’ when the numeral hos ‘one’ is omitted, the distributive suffix -t'a is added to the numeral hos ‘one’ followed by the numeral ‘thousand’ or ‘million’» [179].
There is also another reduplicated form of the distributive pronoun which is more emphatic and which is formed by adding the suffix -t'a to each reduplicant, e.g. hos-t'a-hos-t'a ‘one each’.
«There are two different ways of forming distributive numerals in Hinuq. The first method is to add the ILOC-Essive suffix -ho to the direct stem of the numeral».

«There are two different ways of forming distributive numerals in Hinuq. The second method is reduplication. Mostly the first syllable (CV) is reduplicated, but it also possible to reduplicate the first CVC or CVCV segment. The copy always preceded the base. Numerals with a root that is longer than CV can have several reduplicated forms that occur in free variation, e.g. oc’eno ‘ten’ has several variants of distributive numerals: o-oc'eno, oc’-oc'eno, and oc'e-oc'eno can be formed from the root oc'e-».
«In addition, both methods (i.e. reduplication and the use of the ILOC-Essive suffix) can be combined. In compound numerals, only the last numeral undergoes reduplication and/or takes case affixes». «Case suffixes are preferably added to the distributive numerals formed by means of reduplication» [407].

«Distributive numerals are formed by reduplication; in addition, a distributive (DISTR) suffix -cər can be added to 'ten' and 'twenty'. The distributive numeral for 'one' is sə.sə». It seems from the examples that the reduplication is often very fragmentary, one or two phonemes from the beginning of the word (for example, o-ʔoq'e-n 'four times'). [isakovkhalilov2001: 270] claims that -no is reduplicated as well: лъино-лъино 'five each'.

Either the root or just the first syllable is reduplicated. According to [alekseevetal1998: 281 (in the file)], «образуются от простых удвоением и удлинением начального комплекса CV-: гьЫ#гьЫс ‘по одному’, къОкъона ‘по два’, лъАлъана ‘по три’ и т. д.». Distributives infelct when substantivized, the same way as cardinals [comrieetal2015: 295]. More on reduplication: [comrieetal2015: 584].
The first root is the clean root, the second is amalgamated with -al the way it its amalgamated in the corresponding cardinal (if -al is present in the cardinal).
example_comment: the second root is altered phonetically because of the following -al. -al loses the vowel

comment: The roots are repeated fully (judging from the examples). As I have understood from the source, -li is adverb suffix; can be wrong.

«Дистрибутивные числительные строятся при помощи редупликации. Обычно (хотя не всегда; см. ниже) редуплицируется последний значимый элемент числительного. Простые числительные первого десятка редуплицируются целиком; при этом суффикс количественных числительных отсутствует. <…> В сложных числительных, оканчивающихся на простые числительные первого десятка, редуплицируется последнее числительное вместе с суффиксом -ra: ср. urek.darš.lib weʕr.c’a.nu kːeʕ-ra~kːeʕ-ra ʻпо 678ʼ. В сложных числительных, оканчивающихся на сотни, наблюдается (за некоторыми исключениями) частичная редупликация: редуплицируется наименование сотен и тысяч вместе с их количеством, ср. хu.da~хu.darš ʻпо 500’, azir.lib urč’em.da~urč’em.darš ʻпо 1900’ с частичным удвоением сложных числительных. <…> Числительное ʻтысяча’ также образует дистрибутивную форму посредством частичной редупликации (azi~azir ʻпо тысяче’), но при наличии собственных разрядов ведет себя как существительное, сопровождаемое дистрибутивным числительным; ср. aʁ˳-aʁ˳ azir ʻпо четыре тысячи’».
«DISTRIBUTIVE NUMERALS are formed by reduplication of cardinal numerals».

«Distributive numerals are formed by reduplicating the root. Optionally the suffix -l(e) follows the reduplicated numeral. The suffix -l(e) seems to be the adverbializer. Note that with distributive numerals the modified noun bears overt plural marking».
Exception: 'first' is not derived by reduplication. The form for 'first' is written by hand in the source, it is something like ca-cleweb (but probably need correction).

«Распределительные числительные в хайдакском диалекте, как в кубачинском и ицаринском, образуются редупликацией непроизводных основ числительных: ца-ца «по одному», чIу-чIу «по два»; гъай-гъай «по двадцать», в отличие от литературного языка: кIи-кIел «по два», хIяб-хIябал «по три»».

«Distributive numerals are derived from the short form by full reduplication of the base numeral (partial reduplication is impossible even in long complex numerals). Distributive numerals can also serve as the base to form multiplicative and group numerals».

example_comment: transcription needs revision. Page [46] defines x̃ as «шумный заднеязычный аспирант», similar to /x/ but /x/ is «глубокий» and /x̃/ is «неглубокий». I have no idea how to show that. Maybe palatalization like /xʲ/?

comment: Distributives can be derived with reduplication of a cardinal root. They can be adverbialized with -ši. [mikailov1967: 81] mentions distributives with -ši only.
Distributives can be derived with reduplication of a collective numeral root. They can be adverbialized with -ši.

In reduplication, the stress is on the first instance of the numeral. In complex numerals, only the last component is reduplicated. However, '100', '1000' and larger numerals are not reduplicated; if they are the last component, the component before them is reduplicated. [alekseevetal1998: 353 (in the file)] gives examples both with reduplication of -d and without: «кьве-кьвед ‘по два’, пуд-пуд ‘по трое’».
Only a part of the first component is reduplicated (the first syllable or the whole numeral [magometov1965: 165]). Unclear what happens in complex numerals.
Unlike [alekseevshixalieva2003: 54], [magometov1965] insists that distributive numerals always have suffix -ǯi (-di in Northern dialect).
Unlike [alekseevshixalieva2003: 54], [magometov1965] insists that distributive numerals always have suffix -di (-ǯi in Northern dialect).

«Распределительные числительные образуются посредством удвоения основ числительных, при этом второе числительное имеет суффикс наречия -di или -tᵊi (<— -di). При удвоении основ числительных в первой части может утратиться корневой согласный». [maisak2014: 398] states that distributive numerals are derived with reduplication but does not mention the suffix.

«Распределительные числительные образуются посредством удвоения основ числительных, при этом второе числительное имеет суффикс наречия -di или -tᵊi (<— -di). При удвоении основ числительных в первой части может утратиться корневой согласный». Burshag idiom uses (apparently, a more archaic) morph -di. [maisak2014: 398] states that distributive numerals are derived with reduplication but does not mention the suffix.
example_comment: transcription needs revision. What's with this umlaut-a? There is no such sign on page [17]

comment:
«В цахурском языке распределительные числительные образуются несколькими способами, которые различаются разной степенью употребительности (например, для сложных числительных допустимы только продуктивные модели образования, а числительные, образованные без удвоения основы, могут использоваться не только в распределительном, но и в собирательном значении). Наиболее распространены распределительные числительные, образуемые удвоением соответствующих количественных (в полной форме), с добавлением морфемы -na 'будучи'».
Suffix -le (CARD) can change to markers of case if the corresponding noun is on oblique case. In this case, -na is omitted (for example, q'oI-n-G̥-ē-q'oI-n-G̥-ē glossed as two-A-OBL.1-ERG-two-A-OBL.1-ERG). In other words, whole forms with inflection are reduplicated [173—174].

«Реже употребляются числительные, образованные аналогичным образом, но без удвоения количественного числительного. Формы без удвоения в зависимости от контекста могут быть поняты как в распределительном, так и в собирательном значении». It is noted that in comparison to the form of distributives with reduplication, this form can express uncertainty in the number (like in: a hundred vs. about a hundred). «Числительные walš 'сто' и āzɨr 'тысяча' могут употребляться с формантом множественного числа» (for example, walš-bɨ-na '[people came] in hundreds' glossed as hundred-PL-NA) [175].

«Имеется также и третья модель образования распределительных числительных — усеченные распределительные числительные, образованные удвоением корня с чередованием гласных. Этот способ образования непродуктивен: существует всего два числительных, образованных от односложных корней, кончающихся на гласный (q'oI-q'aI-na 'по два' и xo-xa-na 'по пять'). Употребление этих слов не отличается от употребления других распределительных числительных. Образование распределительного числительного от основы за 'один' несколько отличается от общего правила. <…> Употребляются [также] формы sas̄a-sas̄a-na и sas̄a-na 'по одному'». [ibragimov1990: 98] also states that only these three numerals ('two', 'five', 'one') have this form.

«Prefixal» numerals (a.k.a. those who have frozen class markers in the beginning, apparently) derive distributives this way, without reduplication. Prefixal numbers are: '4', '6', '7', '8', '9', '10'. Class markers are usually omitted but there is evidence that sometimes they are present in this form. -na sometimes undergoes pharyngealization. [mukhin2020: 19] states that -na is the adverbial suffix. «[There is] evidence that the forms with -na are primary».
It is said that it is possible to derive distributive numerals both with and without class markers (for most numerals). -na sometimes undergoes pharyngealization.
Numerals are repeated fully. No info on complex numerals.

sa-r-sa-r (one-CM-one-CM) means 'one to another' («un à un»). Beginning with 'two', this construction has a distributive meaning. According to [starostin: 437], «the first component of the reduplication need not have its suffixal marker». He gives examples like: sa-(r)-sa-r 'one each'.

No description, just examples in the dictionary. The numbers са-са-р 'one each' and кьу-кьу-р 'two each' have the suffix -r [195], it seems that other numbers do not (онгъ-онгъ [236], пхьу-пхьу [243]).
[alekseevetal1998: 436 (in the file)] gives the same examples without -r (written with different orthography): «разделительные (образуемые редупликацией: пшо-пшо ‘по три’, онгъ-онгъ ‘по-четыре’)».

In simple twenties, the number of twenties is reduplicated (for example, кху-кху-з-ткъа 'sixty each'), in complex twenties the unit is reduplicated (ткъиэ итт-итт 'thirty each' twenty ten-ten). Numbers 1, 2, 3, 20 undergo additional phonetic change.
example_comment: The cardinal is ткъиэ итт '30'. Transcription accordingly to [nichols1994: 51], morpho-phonemic [p. 7]

comment: «For '1' to '3' the distributive is formed by suffixing a reduplicated and geminated copy of the initial consonant, to which the pronominal oblique endings are attached. From '4' on it is formed by simple doubling of the nominative cardinal (attributive form). Nominalized and attributive forms are identical in the nominative. Nominalized distributives were difficult to elicit and were often replaced by cardinals or attributive distributives. The nominalized form has case inflection but no gender; it is used in apposition to a pronoun or noun with which a verb or other agreeing word agrees». Unlike in Chechen, simple tens reduplicate fully (for example, qouztq'a qouztq'a 'sixty each') [214], no info on larger complex numerals.

In most of the examples the first component is full, the second one undergoes lenition but there is an example in which it's the other way around (Dʕi-Dʕivʔ 'four each'). [desheriev1953: 190] describes it like this: if the cardinal ends with a vowel, it's dropped out in the second component. More examples in [desheriev1953: 202].

The vowel undergoes singarmonic change. The suffix is attached to the last component of the complex numeral. «В разделительных числительных, обозначающих сотни и тысячи разделительный аффикс присоединяется к предыдущему слову: бирер юз „по сто“, бирер минг „по тысяча“». «Субстантивированные разделительные числительные употребляются чаще всего в формах винительного, направительного и исходного падежей: би-рерлеп ал „бери по одному“, экишер тюшдю „досталось по три“» [233].

The vowel undergoes singarmonic change. «Разделительные числительные образуются и при помощи аффикса –лап, -леп: онлап „по десять“, бешлеп „по пять“, дёртлеп „по четыре“». Confusion: [bammatov2013: 108] shows this form as collective: «ДЁРТЕВ числ. собир. чéтверо (о людях); олар ~ бар эди их было чéтверо; ~ - ~ по четыре (человека); ~леп вчетверóм».

The vowels undergo singarmonic change. «Собирательные числительные с афф. -ар (-ер) принимают афф. -лап (-леп), при этом они, сохраняя свое узуальное значение, приобретают новые семантические и стилистические окраски: прибавляется оттенок взаимности, совместности: Уьчерлеп гелдилер „(Они) пришли по трое“».
«Довольно активно употребляются в значении собирательности, совокупности количественные числительные, снабженные аффиксами принадлежности множественного числа –быз/-ыбыз: биз уьчюбюз де „мы втроем“: сиз уьчюгюз де „вы втроем“; уьчюсю де „они втроем“».
This form is mentioned as collective with adverbial features on the page [240] and as a form of distributives on the page [243]. Unclear if that's the same form.
The form for 'one each' is бирəр-бирəр, which means 'alone'. It is unclear whether the R-R model is possible for 'one each' in the source.
The vowels undergo singarmonic change. /s/ is added if the root ends with a vowel.
The vowels undergo singarmonic change.
The vowels undergo singarmonic change.

«Pour ‘un chacun’ (et parfois ‘deux chacun’), on forme le distributif par redoublement». This seems to mean that this form exists for 'one' and 'two' only. However, [naftaliev2016] has examples of distributives for larger numbers (for example, ħəşt-ħəşt 'eight each' [page 223]). Also, there is a word herki which can mean the same when put before the numeral.
-i is nominative suffix.
